channel.title: Everything Gets Really Dark
channel.description:
So, in some areas of the game (particularly in darker areas) the games gets way too dark. Flashlight won't even do anything to help. It isn't my monitor brightness, because when I first load an a new area it will be normal brightness, then gradually fade to almost unseeable black. Here's a before/after shot of what I mean.
when I first load the save [img]https://i.imgur.com/nCnjDXY.jpg[/img]
a couple seconds later [img]https://i.imgur.com/8QG3Tro.jpg[/img]
I think it has something to do with the HDR lighting, but I honestly have no clue.

To Fix The Over Darkening Issue

Type the following two commands into console

mat_hdr_level 2
mat_tonemapping_occlusion_use_stencil 1

item.title: Everything Gets Really Dark
item.dc:creator: RedEye
item.description:
You may need to Verify the integrity of your Game Cache. Right click Black Mesa, Click Properties, then click “Verify Integrity of Game files.” Let it do its thing, and download anything missing/corrupted.

Have you entered any console commands, if so what ones.

Have you entered anything in the Launch Options.

This thread contains fixes for fullbright issues (normally too bright, not too dark like what you are experiencing). it might be helpful https://steamcommunity.com/app/362890/discussions/0/620712999974203382/

You might try posting over on the steam forums, someone might have seen this before. https://steamcommunity.com/app/362890/discussions/0/

Some laptops have an auto-dimming feature https://lifehacker.com/disable-windows-annoying-adaptive-brightness-feature-on-1567886994

Post your system specs, cpu, os , ram, gpu etc…
